name: Burmese Bites
address: Queens Center Mall Food Court, 90-15 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11373, USA

reviews.text: Our dining here resulted in plans to return soon. Outstanding food available without excessive cost. The team demonstrates exceptional pleasantness. The up-to-date decor still feels welcoming and warm. The flavors here blend perfectly!

The restaurant helps define what makes our area special. If I'm nearby, this restaurant is getting my business. The cooking here is outstanding & honestly, every dish I've tried has been excellent. The staff here pays close attention to your needs. I'm thrilled to have found this fantastic restaurant.

The restaurant lives up to its acclaimed status. Burmese Bites delivers on multiple fronts. Their team delivers superior experiences. The inside area never felt too dark. I'm anxious to return at the earliest opportunity.

I feel at ease in this place. I enjoyed myself because of who I was with, and the restaurant did its part well. Their food is outstanding and fairly priced. Their attentiveness was the highlight. My household has found a reliable restaurant.

The staff worked efficiently without ever making us feel rushed. The workers are fantastic! Affordable menu with better-than-expected quality. The food quality was consistent throughout the meal. I located this appealing restaurant via internet reviews.
Waited 20 min and they forgot to make my order until I went up

This place gives you reasons to return through quality food, friendly service, and a perfect spot. Workers here demonstrate unusual warmth and ensure customer satisfaction. This restaurant serves traditional recipes well. You'll feel the care in the atmosphere. I suggested this place to others.
Fantastic food. Worth a detour. Order lots cause not much like it elsewhere!

This place provides exactly what I want in a restaurant. Workers here deliver highly attentive service customized to each guest. Their cooking impresses alongside creative menu options. Burmese Bites never misses the mark. The restaurant provides numerous impressive aspects.
One of the best tea leaf salad I have ever had.  It's in a food court, so it's reasonably priced.   I will go back to try other things.
Tried Burmese cuisine for the first time here and I am honestly blown away. Some of the best dishes I've ever tried and I can't wait to come back for more.
Nan Gyi Thoke was great. The keema paratha was dry for me. So I asked the chef for the curry and she poured some chicken curry on it and it tasted great.

Our favorite spot in the food court!! the rainbow salad is the best and comes with chickpea tofu and onion/potato spring rolls. Everything is fresh tasting.  The pea palata is also great and a filling appetizer. I never had Burmese food before but it‚Äôs amazing and I tell everyone about it

The chicken curry and paratha. Truly. The best thing at the Queens Night Market. Maybe one of the best curries in NYC. I swear. It‚Äôs insanely good. Cinnamon-y, warm flavour. Omg. It‚Äôs so delicious.
At the night market, it‚Äôs a generous portion for $5. Such a great deal.

How many great meals did I miss by waiting so long? The food quality matches the menu originality. Worker service defined the experience. The tiny restaurant serves surprisingly good dishes. You'll want to taste everything they offer.

Came across this gem several months ago while visiting the Queens Center Mall with my mom. It's become our favourite food spot whenever we go shopping. The food is always fresh and flavorful. The portions are generous. The owners and other staff are also extremely nice and accommodating to special requests (my mom is disabled and requires her food to be served a certain way). Money well spent. Highly recommend!
A person I know from Myanmar told me to check this restaurant out. I got the chicken and potato curry. It has so many flavors that match well.
Go to Burmese place in NYC. Really clean. Authentic taste , Highly recommended.
I came here because they serve halal food.
It's good food for the price and service was wonderful. But it's in a mall so the surroundings could be a lot for people who value space and peaceful surroundings

The food is fantastic. The first bite was just delicious with amazing flavor! You can adjust spice level to your liking (or not at all). Ate every bite! Would have missed it as others have stated if not for the good reviews. I will be back.

Most of my family and I were born in Yangon, Burma. It's been quite some time since we had Burmese food. For an early Mother's Day celebration, we decided to try Burmese Bites. We ordered a variety of dishes including keema palata, nan gyi thoke, dum pot, tofu thoke, ohno kaukswe, laphet thoke, faluda, and mont lat saung.

Overall, I'd give the meal four stars. While the flavors brought back nostalgic memories, the packaging could have been improved‚Äîsome of the oil from the tofu thoke and laphet thoke leaked into the bag. We were also disappointed with the faluda, which lacked flavor, and the mont lat saung, which was overly sweet and thick. Additionally, we wished monhinga had been available on the menu.

Despite some drawbacks, the meal was a special treat, and it was wonderful to enjoy the flavors of home again.

Been treating myself to these beautiful people for a few years now, I've never had the luxury of Burmese Food let alone ANY Indian-Adjacent Cuisine at all! ü•πüëëüíì

The staff are so chill, they have Vegan and Vegetarian options and Halal friendly! If you're tired of there being NO South East Asian or Desi food in your Shopping Experience COME TO THESE ICONS!!!

I grew up on Guyanese Food and quite literally cried eating their Potato and Chicken Curry. Thanks for making our shared culture more accessible ü´Çüíñ
The Rainbow Salad is the most delicious vegetarian option at the mall
Absolute amazing food if you go you must try the chicken coconut noodle soup. It is the best chicken noodle soup I‚Äôve ever had in my whole life. I am definitely coming back.

It was really good , even though we only tried one item which was coconut ramen and it was good specially if you like curry like ramen ,. And I believe it‚Äôs also a good place as an halal ramen place
The food was amazing and the Owner was super friendly answered my questions on the cuisine & he didn‚Äôt fail to deliver when it came to his food! 10/10

I'm a certified chicken hater, but the curry chicken from Burmese Bites converted me üêî
The BEST chicken I've ever had in my life.

Food is so tasty .
Great service
Consistency is key. Always a good meal

The food was exceptional, bursting with flavor. A hidden gem in Queens.
We had Keema plata, Nan gyi thoke, and the tea leaf salad. Phenomenal!
The food here is refreshingly authentic, flavorful and delicious. Ordered the tea leaf salad, udon noodle salad and keema plata, and all were amazing. Can‚Äôt wait to come back to try more dishes.

I finally found an authentic Burmese food in NYC. It‚Äôs been so long since I‚Äôve had authentic Burmese food like back home in Burma. If you want to experience authentic Burmese food, this is the place. Everything taste delicious
Delicious

It's my first try at Burmese (from Myanmar) food, and I'm amazed by the quality of the food here. It's so good I'm writing this review at the table just as I finished the palata, potato curry, noddles and tea leaf salad. It is unexpectedly excellent and god-tier level gourmet for a mall food court, so much that it deserves to be its own sit-in restaurant. I was not in a mood for mall fast food at all, and this place served up subtle, spicy goodness that hit the spot perfectly. This is probably what home cooking tastes like if I had a Burmese mother, but I don't know, and can't compare it to other Burmese places because this was my first, but the food is good as is, regardless of what cuisine it is. It's as if a Halal truck ran over a beautiful menagerie of Southeast Asian cuisines and reincarnated into this place. It still feels like the best kept secret, since it's in the back corner of the food court, but I surely hope more people will discover it.

Phenomenal food! Lots of delicious vegan options, just ask! The tea leaf salad can be made vegan and is not to be missed. The tofu salad is so unique and delicious. The people are so nice and welcoming. One of my favorite spots in Queens. Incredible value as well. I come to the mall to eat at this place and it‚Äôs always worth it.

The noodle dishes are good, the palatas are reasonably priced, but I have to agree with another reviewer who asked why this place is closed on a Sunday. Every business deserves a day off, of course, but why on a weekend day at a shopping mall?
This is the one of the beat burmese food in the town. I recommend the chicken payata. I always order that when i went there
Food was yummy and fresh, owner was so nice and you can tell they really care about the food and customers enjoying their food. Thank you so much!
Their coconut soup is very delicious
I had the tea leaf salad, chicken keema and sweet tea. Can't wait to return and try more!!

My burmese friend brought me here because she said this is the most authentic burmese food she's ever had in the U.S. And it did not disappoint! We got tea leaf salad and 2 noodle dishes (sorry, not good with names). You can ask them to adjust the spice depending on your tolerance. All the dishes were so flavorful and packs a punch. It's like a flavor bomb in your mouth. The tea leaf salad was my favorite. Loved how refreshing it was.  It was crunchy and full of texture. Really helps cut away the grease and helps with how heavy the other dishes are.

Going through the mall I was looking for a decent place to eat.  If not for the good reviews I would have walked right past.  I‚Äôm glad I went to them because it was some of the best food I‚Äôve had in a long time.  They need some good marketing because the food is insane and I would have missed it if not for google.
amazing food
Delicious and affordable option, complex and wonderfully prepared dishes. The palata  and tea leaf salad were excellent. Thank you

Becoming my favorite for Asian spot
My first time for Burmese food.
Everything was beyond my expectations
Cashier was nice and kind
Food was great!

One of the highlights of my workweek is when Burmese Bites sets up their pop-up in our office cafe, bringing a burst of culinary excitement to the everyday routine. The staff's warmth and the reasonable prices are definite pluses, but it's the incredible food that truly steals the show. Their Ohno Kaukswe, a hearty chicken noodle soup brimming with complex flavors, is a personal favorite that never fails to satisfy and delight.

Mega feines und authentisches birmanisches Essen.
Freundliches Personal und gro√üe Portionen.
Wer die birmanische K√ºche ausprobieren will, ist hier am richtigen Platz.
Fried chicken dumplings superb!

Family-owned and operated. Incredible tasting, authentic Burmese food.

Great value with affordable dishes and generous portions, this establishment is hands down the best among all the food options in QCM. An absolute must try.

If you haven‚Äôt stopped by here when you visit the mall you need to change that ASAP. I honestly had no idea what Burmese food was until I walked up and I‚Äôm so happy I decided to try it. I got the tea leaf salad and the udon and I was disappointed when the dishes were done. They‚Äôre equally full of distinct, unique, beautiful flavors that made me want to keep coming back for more. I can‚Äôt wait until I come back.

I‚Äôm not eating meat at the moment so  it was nice to find a restaurant with vegan/vegetarian options other than fries. I tried the tofu bites with a sweet chili type sauce.  Very delicious. Nice crispy exterior and soft interior. The price was a little over $5; great value for the portion size. I would recommend this place.

Walking into the food court, I didn‚Äôt expect for any restaurant to be serving at the level of quality that Burmese Bites does. The low prices, short wait, fresh ingredients, and friendly owners make this place absolutely fantastic. The menu is streamlined and simple, and offers all kinds of great Burmese foods. I ordered the Ohno Kaukswe (Burmese Coconut Ramen/·Ä°·ÄØ·Äî·Ä∫·Ä∏·Äî·Ä≠·ÄØ·Ä∑·ÄÅ·Ä±·Ä´·ÄÄ·Ä∫·ÄÜ·ÄΩ·Ä≤) and was extremely happy with my choice. The cilantro and onion that garnished the broth and noodles were very fresh, and the coconut-based broth was so comforting. Such a great dish to have on a cold day. My friend got the Keema Palata‚Äîit was crispy and very well seasoned. The chicken curry roti was great as well, but above all, I would recommend the Ohno Kaukswe. Absolutely give this place a try. There‚Äôs a reason they‚Äôre so highly rated!!

This is a gem hidden inside Queens Center Mall‚Äôs food court! We have been following Burmese Bites on Instagram and we‚Äôre excited to see they have a real brick and mortar (almost!) spot where we can find them other than at the Queens Night Market.

We ordered the tea leaf salad to go. The service was quick (took less than 7 min) and thoughtful. It‚Äôs the only time I‚Äôve ever been given friendly instructions on how to serve and plate my food from a food court!

We came home and put the salad together according to the instructions we were given. The tea leaf salad was just as delicious as I remember from the Knight market and other Burmese restaurants I‚Äôve been to that I‚Äôve enjoyed. A salad is layered with so many different textures and flavors and spices that it‚Äôs just like a dance with every crunch in your mouth. I also am shocked at how cheap everything is on this menu. Please go here and give them some business because we definitely need to spread the love of delicious Burmese food.

I had the chance to cross Burmese Bites off my bucket list, and it was a satisfying experience. Located in the Queens Mall food court, the Nan Gyi Toke (Burmese Udon Noodles salad with chicken) truly impressed me with its authentic flavors. The Shan noodles salad, however, didn't quite align with my taste preferences. They cooked with Halal meat. Nevertheless, I'm excited to return and explore more dishes from their menu. Next on my list is the Keema paratha. This spot definitely has potential, and I can't wait to discover more from their menu.

Honestly, this restaurant is such a hidden gem inside QCM's food court! I ordered the coconut curry chicken soup and the kaneef palat, both were absolutely delicious and bursting with flavor. The prices are great for the amount of food they serve. Highly recommend!

One of New York's best food places acting low key in the Queens center food court. Truly exceptional food, with more flavor than any Asian restaurant I have been to in NYC, with very good rates and portions. The Burmese sweet tea was so amazing that we got two of each. Very strongly recommend.

They have authentic Burmese cuisine with interesting options like fermented tea leaf salad,  mango salad and other classics like dum pot biryani, ohno kaukswe (chicken curry with noodle), their star palata with curry/ keema, other noodle dishes etc. They have good descriptions of the items and have vegan options for five of them.

They also have a good set of desserts including falooda, shaved ice, mont lat sang (green tea based) etc.

Strongly recommend the biryani, chicken curry and the sweet tea. Ample seating in the food court.

If you‚Äôre not eating here regularly, you‚Äôre making a mistake. The food is so delicious, filed with so many flavors and textures. It‚Äôs family owned and run. The portion sizes are generous too. Burmese food is such a treasure. One of my favorites is the mango salad, the keema palata, any dish with chicken and try the drinks!

Burmese Bites is the best food that the QCM food court has to offer. They deserve their own restaurant!! Their food is top quality, rich with flavor with portions that will fill you up and you‚Äôll have leftovers for later! Not to sound dramatic, but this food changed my life, I can‚Äôt believe I didn‚Äôt know about them sooner.
I tried their food at the Queens Night Market, and now every time I go to QCM I can‚Äôt skip Burmese Bites! Definitely get Burmese Bites the next time you stop by QCM. They deserve more love!! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

South East Asian represent right here inside the Queens Center Mall‚Äôs food court! So many unique halal Burmese dishes to try! The chicken palata beats any roti canai served in the neighborhood. The tea leaf salad was super crunchy and their Burmese shaved ice was a sweet treat! Don‚Äôt forget to check their booth at Queens Night Market in Corona.
Food was quite authentic and fresh. portions are out of this world. All this food for around 60$. Friendly and quick service too. definitely 10/10! must check it out!

A hidden gem in my opinion. Not a lot of people know about Burmese cuisine which is heavily influenced by Chinese & Indian. Try Coconut chicken noodle soup, dum pot (Burmese chicken biryani), or tea salad. And Yes, I know the picture I uploaded in the review is an empty bowl because it was quite  good & I didn‚Äôt even remember to take a photo until I finished eating it.

Edit: *back to this place* still üëçüèΩ pics are dry noodle dishes

I ordered the vegan pea paleta it‚Äôs super good vegan dish 9.1/10 The coconut chicken noodle soup was a delicious meal 10.9/10 It will definitely satisfy you. The tea is not good, it tasted old and burnt 0/10 When I ate the chicken paleta I was disappointed also because the meat was not fresh and the bread was very greasy 5/10. I do like the service and the staff though they are very nice people and have good budget affordable prices.
Outstanding, unique food. And great service! Don't miss the unique Burmese chickpea "tofu"--awesome texture and flavor and definitely my favorite dish I've tried here.

This was my first time trying Burmese food. Wow. It was a game changer.

We were at Japan Fest and were in line for the other popular items. This stall was a hidden gem. I ordered the Nan Gyi Kaukswe Thoke aka Burmese Udon Noodle Salad. We claimed this dish to be the best dish we tried in the whole food festival.

Staff are genuinely kind and excited for you to try a piece of their culture. I really wish I lived close enough to order again!

Absolutely loved the food here. The kaukswe thoke (Burmese udon noodle salad) and ohno kaukswe (coconut chicken noodle soup) were phenomenal. The food was fresh and delicious and service was warm, friendly and honest. The price was very affordable too. Highly recommend this restaurant!

A couple co-workers of mine and I ate here for an early dinner. The customer service, halal food and drink options, and prices are great.

I tried the Keema Palata which had a chicken and onion filling paired with a side of cucumber relish sauce. I kind of wished there were other sauces available for the palata such as something along the lines of a nuoc mam cham or a spicy sauce but maybe it is not traditional. As for beverage and dessert, I got the Burmese Sweet Hot Tea and Mont Lat Saung. It was perfect to end my meal with!

All of the food is prepared to order so take caution with hot items.

I have been craving Authentic Burmese food for long time. I happened to stop in at this store in Queen Center and magically meet with the owner.
He is super friendly and provided all I needed.  All the food I got taste‚Ä¶

Very nice gem and unexpected find in the food court of a mall. The food is prepared immediately after your order (vs sitting in a hotplate). We got the Burmese bento box and the shan kaukswe, and both dishes were very flavorful. The curry is delicious and the chicken is very tender. The mango salad is soft (which I personally don't mind because it means it's sweeter) and I really like the cilantro that accompanies it, making it a refreshing bite to accompany the curry. They mixed the ingredients in the noodle dish and that was also very good. Great value too. Definitely worth trying.

Having grown up in Burma, I‚Äôve tried a lot of Burmese restaurants across SF and LA and I have to say that the food here truly hits the spot ‚Äî not only are they full of flavor, they might be the most authentic Burmese dishes I‚Äôve had outside of Burma. They‚Äôre also super affordable, most mains ~$10!

All the dishes are amazing, but you really have to try the Burmese biryani, tea leaf salad, and chicken curry naan.

Thankfully they also are available in delivery apps (though be cautious ordering soupier dishes) so I already ordered another dish to have before I fly out of NY!

Cannot recommend enough

Had to try this new spot in QCM! Love seeing southeast Asian culture being represented! Their portions are big and their food is super delicious! I hope they stay around because I‚Äôll def be back to try other dishes! It‚Äôs also HALAL!

Hidden gem right here!!

I ordered the ohno kaukswe noodle soup for lunch. The flavor is on the savory side with a splash of lime to give it the balance of flavor. Tbh the food here is pretty exotic and hard to find in other locations. I am a local from woodside and I really like this place!

Delicious Burmese food.
The most authentic are Tea Leaf salad aka" Laphat Thoke " and "Mohingha" fish flavour noodle soup which can get only in Burma.

The chicken palata beats any roti canai served in the neighborhood. And the noodles pictured comes in a great broth and there are chicken chunks, onions, half an egg hiding in the bottom.

I walked here 40 mins in the cold just for the food and I was not disappointed. Will definitely be making the trip again soon.

Everything was actually at a very high temperature, so if you are considering ordering delivery, it should not reach you cold.

The rave reviews on their dum pot speak the truth, this is one big, generous, hearty and delicious dum pot for $8.95! The storeowners are really friendly and lovely people too, I'll be back to try their other items like the ohno kaukswe (coconut noodles) and laphet (tea leaf salad, which they make by themselves). If you like Burmese food, this is the place to go to, and if you have never tried Burmese food, this is definitely the place to begin with!

Pro tip: on Wednesdays, they have mohinga.
